creator: rensjuh@gmail.com
text:
When adding the configuration for PHP, the following 2 lines:
LoadModule php5_module "C:/webserver/PHP/php5apache2.dll"
AddType application/x-httpd-php .php
You'll get an error from Apache.
The error contains:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 115 of C:/webserver/Apache Software
Foundation/Apache2.2/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load
C:/webserver/PHP/php5apache2.dll into server: Cannot find the module.

The version of Apache is 2.2.2, and the version of PHP is 5.1.4.
After I saw that error, I was going to try it with an older version of Apache
(2.0.58) and it worked with that version.

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Have you compiled PHP against 2.2.2? Modules for 2.0.x and 2.2.x are binary
incompatible. You need to recompile modules for 2.2.2.

creator: rensjuh@gmail.com
text:
I downloaded the Apache 2.2.2 Win32 binary, and the PHP 5.1.4 zip package, also
the Win32 binary.
I never had to compile anything, so I'm not sure whát and how I have to compile.
Can you give me a link or so to a page how to compile PHP against Apache 2.2.2?

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
I guess that is the exact problem: The binary packages that can be downloaded at
php.net are not compiled against 2.2.x httpd's.
I found the following link in the php manual:
http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.windows.building.php.
I guess it would be also an option for you to open an enhancement bug at php.net
and ask for php binaries compiled against httpd 2.2.x.

creator: rensjuh@gmail.com
text:
There was already a php5 Module for apache, that was compiled against Apache 2.2.2.
Here is the link to the bug report on php.net:
http://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=37436

I have version 2.2.3 and have the same problem of php modules not loading.
Here is the error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load E:
/php/php5/php5apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be found.

I have even copied the php module to the apache modules director and still get 
the error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load E:
/Apache/modules/php5apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be f
ound.
I also tried php version 4 and get error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load E:
/php/php4/php4apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be found.

I have had no problems with version 2.0.55 loading these modules.
creator: mypepper@lwgreys.com
the_angry_angel@blueyonder.co.uk
text:
Is php5ts.dll in the same area? If apache cant find this file, then it wont run.
Typically a way to cheat is to make sure that the PHP files are in the PATH -
you can either do this by adding the PHP directory to the PATH or copying the
files to a directory that is already in the PATH :)

Hopefully that should resolve it for you. Also make sure you are using the
php5apache2_2.dll :) (I've not tested this on Win32, but it should work by all
accounts)

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
The pre-built PHP Win32 binary which will work against 2.2.x is called
"php5apache22.dll" AFAIK - for further help with PHP please see:

  http://www.php.net/support.php
